title: Berlidin / Volta regular italic?
content:
Does anyone know of an italic version of the typeface [Volta](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018071237/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=UR.110085.0.0)?  
The only one I can find is for Volta Medium, but I'm using the Regular weight.

[Berlidin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018071237/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/berlidin/) is very similar, but doesn't have any italics at all...

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.  
Thanks.
author: bshaykin

comments.content:
[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/clarendon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018071237/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/clarendon/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/clarendon/")

You could try Clarendon but it is an oblique rather than an italic  
Tim

Volta is very similar (but wider) to [Clarendon Wide and Extra Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018071237/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=UR.110045.0.0) family. Not exact, but the family has multiple oblique weights.

Whoops! Too late!

Thanks so much for all of your suggestions. Definitely some good options, but I wish these other types had the same "softness" that I see in Volta and Berlidin. Is there a better (technical) term for that?
